trans-unit.source: Optional: Configure a new storage account for the service
trans-unit.target: Optional: Configure a new storage account for the service

trans-unit.source: Explains how to configure a storage account for the StorSimple Manager service running Update 1.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to configure a storage account for the StorSimple Manager service running Update 1.

trans-unit.source: To add a storage account in StorSimple 8000 Series Update 1.0
trans-unit.target: To add a storage account in StorSimple 8000 Series Update 1.0

trans-unit.source: On the StorSimple Manager service landing page, select your service and double-click it.
trans-unit.target: On the StorSimple Manager service landing page, select your service and double-click it.

trans-unit.source: This will take you to the Quick Start page.
trans-unit.target: This will take you to the Quick Start page.

trans-unit.source: Select the Configure page.
trans-unit.target: Select the Configure page.

trans-unit.source: Click Add/edit storage account.
trans-unit.target: Click Add/edit storage account.

trans-unit.source: In the Add/Edit Storage Account dialog box, click Add new.
trans-unit.target: In the Add/Edit Storage Account dialog box, click Add new.

trans-unit.source: In the Provider field, select the appropriate cloud service provider.
trans-unit.target: In the Provider field, select the appropriate cloud service provider.

trans-unit.source: The supported providers are Azure, Amazon S3, Amazon S3 with RRS, HP and OpenStack.
trans-unit.target: The supported providers are Azure, Amazon S3, Amazon S3 with RRS, HP and OpenStack.

trans-unit.source: Specify the credentials and the location associated with the storage account of your cloud service providers.
trans-unit.target: Specify the credentials and the location associated with the storage account of your cloud service providers.

trans-unit.source: The fields presented for credentials will be different depending upon the cloud service provider you have specified.
trans-unit.target: The fields presented for credentials will be different depending upon the cloud service provider you have specified.

trans-unit.source: If you have selected Azure as your cloud service provider, supply the Name and the primary Access Key for your Microsoft Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: If you have selected Azure as your cloud service provider, supply the Name and the primary Access Key for your Microsoft Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: For an Azure account, the location will be automatically populated.
trans-unit.target: For an Azure account, the location will be automatically populated.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Azure storage account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Azure storage account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have selected Amazon S3 or Amazon S3 with RRS, provide a friendly Storage Account name, Access Key, and Secret Key.
trans-unit.target: If you have selected Amazon S3 or Amazon S3 with RRS, provide a friendly Storage Account name, Access Key, and Secret Key.

trans-unit.source: For Amazon S3 and Amazon S3 with RRS, the following locations are supported:
trans-unit.target: For Amazon S3 and Amazon S3 with RRS, the following locations are supported:

trans-unit.source: US Standard
trans-unit.target: US Standard

trans-unit.source: US West (Oregon)
trans-unit.target: US West (Oregon)

trans-unit.source: US West (Northern California)
trans-unit.target: US West (Northern California)

trans-unit.source: EU (Ireland)
trans-unit.target: EU (Ireland)

trans-unit.source: Asia Pacific (Singapore)
trans-unit.target: Asia Pacific (Singapore)

trans-unit.source: Asia Pacific (Sydney)
trans-unit.target: Asia Pacific (Sydney)

trans-unit.source: Asia Pacific (Tokyo)
trans-unit.target: Asia Pacific (Tokyo)

trans-unit.source: South America (Sao Paulo)
trans-unit.target: South America (Sao Paulo)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Amazon storage account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Amazon storage account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have selected HP as your cloud service provider, supply a friendly Storage Account Name, Tenant ID, Username, and Password.
trans-unit.target: If you have selected HP as your cloud service provider, supply a friendly Storage Account Name, Tenant ID, Username, and Password.

trans-unit.source: For HP, the following locations are supported:
trans-unit.target: For HP, the following locations are supported:

trans-unit.source: US East
trans-unit.target: US East

trans-unit.source: US West
trans-unit.target: US West

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add HP storage account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add HP storage account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have selected Openstack as your cloud service provider, provide a Hostname, Access Key, and Secret Key.
trans-unit.target: If you have selected Openstack as your cloud service provider, provide a Hostname, Access Key, and Secret Key.

trans-unit.source: For all the cloud service providers, excluding Azure, a friendly name is allowed.
trans-unit.target: For all the cloud service providers, excluding Azure, a friendly name is allowed.

trans-unit.source: You can use different friendly names and create more than one storage account with the same set of credentials.
trans-unit.target: You can use different friendly names and create more than one storage account with the same set of credentials.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Openstack storage account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Openstack storage account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SSL Mode to create a secure channel for network communication between your device and the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SSL Mode to create a secure channel for network communication between your device and the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Clear the Enable SSL Mode check box only if you are operating within a private cloud.
trans-unit.target: Clear the Enable SSL Mode check box only if you are operating within a private cloud.

trans-unit.source: If you are using HP as your provider, SSL will always be enabled.
trans-unit.target: If you are using HP as your provider, SSL will always be enabled.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon <linkText>check icon</linkText>.
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon <linkText>check icon</linkText>.

trans-unit.source: You will be notified after the storage account is successfully created.
trans-unit.target: You will be notified after the storage account is successfully created.

trans-unit.source: The newly created storage account will be displayed on the Configure page under Storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: The newly created storage account will be displayed on the Configure page under Storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: Click Save to save the new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Click Save to save the new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Click OK when prompted for confirmation.
trans-unit.target: Click OK when prompted for confirmation.
